pros: Nice people to work with, are always willing to lend a helping hand when needed.
cons:
It is hard to advance here, there is a lot of favoritisms and Good Ole' Boy mentality. Work Load exceeds pay. 
Many departments have trouble hanging on to instructors, due to the chairperson having an "I" and "Me" complex. Chair does not know how to take suggestions from instructors, and when things go south due to their inability to lead properly, they turn around and blame the instructors. The leadership problems start at the top and trickle down hill from there.

pros: family work balance. You get days off according to the school schedule.
cons: The communication levels are not good

pros: Great community atmosphere and employee support.
cons: No cons as far as I am concerned.

pros:
great people
lots of time off

pros: It is not bad in one's opinion.

pros: It’s great to get the college breaks off!
cons: Terrible pay & no OT budgeting.

pros: Student friendly, decent retirement plan
cons: Administration seriously micro-manages in areas that are not their expertise. Weak professional development for teachers.

pros: great faculty and staff, pay, benefits, culture, holidays
cons: there are none, balance, none, none, none

pros: Helping students, generous holidays, summers optional. Campus employees are like family. Lots of change, since each semester is different. Base salary can be increased by overload pay each semester and teaching in the summer term.
cons: Very nominal pay raises and not every year. Family health insurance is outrageous with a high deductible and no co-pay (80/20)! High percentage for mandatory retirement contribution. This all greatly affects take home pay.

review_title: Conservative and steady, keep your head down and everyone treats you right.
pros:
Benefits add almost 10k to my salary.
Family oriented, easy to take off.
many holidays and other paid days off.
cons: Very political, the different campus do not work together well. It is hard to make any changes or improvements. The C level talks a lot about innovation but in reality are very much about the status quo.

pros: Very rewarding work guiding students on their educational paths to careers. Time off is exceptional. Coworkers and Admin care about students and great to work with.
cons: Last minute requests for information or policy/procedure changes. Every once in a while there is a difficult student. However, admin and security can handle those situations quickly and fairly.

pros: The best part of the job was paid holidays and weekends off.
cons: There is very little increase in pay.  There is definitely no cost of living increase in pay.  The only individuals that are able to climb the corporate ladder are those of European Descent.  So, if your African-American you may want to stay away from this company.  The only areas that African-Americans are allowed to work in are the cafeteria, housekeeping, or financial aid.  There are NO OPPORTUNITIES for AFRICAN-AMERICANS!!!!!

review_title: The most genuine bunch of people I know.
pros: Comradary, the feeling of being a part of something bigger. You can always know your job is important and that you are heard. Excellent Benefits. Unbeatable vacation time.
cons: Interdepartmental drama gets a little weird sometimes, but that's kind of anywhere you go. Although I don't mean weird as in aggravating.... it is just simply odd.

job_title: Executive Vice President in Perkinston, MS
pros: The leadership, the vision, and the students. The students are amazing, talented, and hardworking. The faculty care about the students and the students are successful.
cons: Most students have trouble believing in the value of community colleges. It’s okay to choose a university but it’s great to start at a community college especially if you need to stay close to home.

pros: Any Campus in the College is great except for the Jackson County Campus Career and Technical programs. Specifically, the Automation, Electronics, and Instrumentation programs, which is horrible.
cons: The Administration and Leadership of Career and Technical Education at the Jackson County Campus are Simply Pathetic. They have no clue of what is being taught and what should be taught.

job_title: Community College Instructor in Gautier, MS
pros: Supportive administration. Great benefits especially state retirement. Coworkers are like a big family. Very rewarding to see the lives of students changed through education!!!
cons: I honestly can't think of any. Even with budget cuts the administration is doing a great job looking toward the future.

pros: Work schedule is great for parents of school aged children
cons: Administration is not very forthcoming about things and some departments are very unorganized. Decisions are always made last minute.

pros: Everyone is so friendlyrics and helpful, I truly enjoyed my job here.
cons: The only con would be that I likedon't my job so much that it made it hard to leave.

review_title: It is a great place to work!
